title: Marketing of Sport & Leisure Services
content:
Marketing Mix

Marketing Mix << what do you put to serve you target customer ex. Yoga
Product What are you offering 45min or 1h
Place Where your customers are Home or gym
Promote How to tell them OLD: Flyer
New: TV/Mobile/Web ads
Price How much Make it affordable v. Premium

Evolution of Businesses

Holistic Marketing how does this come about Example
Production(process) Low costs vs. Overcapacity Developing Countries (Cheap labor)
Products Innovation Electric cars (Tesla/BYD) instead of Gas cars
Sales Getting rid of excess inventories Sales channel/public praise (sellers leading)
Marketing Market driven/customer-centered Customers put demands, sellers provide solutions (customer oriented)

Markets is a collection of buyers and sellers who transact over a particular product. (Kotler and Keller)

Markets is the activity, set of institutions, and processes for creating, communicating, delivering, and exchanging offerings that have value for customers, clients, partners, and society at large. (American Marketing Association)

Marketing Management: The art and science of choosing target markets and getting, keeping, and growing customers through creating, delivering, and communicating superior customer value.

Importance… VALUE

League of Their Own: SPORTS VALUE

Policies for

  • Managing league structure, composition, and team location
  • Increasing relative game quality and competitive balance
  • Regulate league costs
  • Regulate league prices
  • Expanding the market for the game (e.g. participation)
  • Broadcasting right agreements
  • Redistribution of income

(Commercial) Markets

Common Ones Ex. Less Common Ex.
Media Web/TV Ads Sports personnel Players
Facilities Stadium/Gym Agents contracts commission
Retailers Periphery goods Sponsors Logos
